intro: Hedyotis valetoniana, commonly known as the velvetleaf or redroot, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, ovate leaves with a rough, hairy texture. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are clustered in cymes and bloom during the warm season. Hedyotis valetoniana is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
